comments.body:
Does it work on Windows? 

PS: I know it is hard to actually test on windows but we want to be sure.
oops I saw your response to @jsafrane above. Since I don't know anything about Windows, lets check with @jingxu97 or @andyzhangx ?
I don't think this would work on Windows, since Windows usually use powershell or dos command for such functionality. Is it possible to add an empty implementation for Windows?

+1 for making two versions of this functions and providing a empty implementation for windows. Having said that, it would be weird if Windows did not support seeking a block device to the end via golang APIs. I could be wrong though and hence to be on safe side.

found related information on os.seek for Windows
https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36019

seems it does not work if it is a directory handle. But not sure about this case.
`VolumeMode: Block` is not supported yet on Windows, maybe return error directly for Windows?
Thanks @andyzhangx , will return an error and leave a `TODO` comment.
This is also done with the latest revision. (Return an error on Windows, not separated functions per OS.)
